channel.title: How to lose a couple pounds. *Tut*
channel.description:
Well i used to be 120 at 12...20 pnds over wait.. :( but i decided to go on a diet :) this is what i did
I bought an mp3 player 60$. Put in a whole load of music in it. Then I cut back on the sugar stuff and ate healthy
Then i rode my bike for like 2weeks around the place. Then started walking alot and alot until i lost at least like 6pounds while listening to my music
Then when i was a little taller and skinner i went to the park and started to jog. For about 2months i jogged. Then i started to run. It was boring and hard at times but you always need to rember that i need to lose this wait. When i was 13 i was 110 lbs and 5ft3 Now im 14 and im 5ft4 and way 114.5 pounds. Im really happy and i just wanted to share this. Some more cool things to do when you jog and walk if you have a puppie / dog it will be much funner.
For drinking i dont recommend gatorade or sports drink but little water. Gatorade and stuff has sugar so you will still be getting more crap in you. This is a great way to get healthy. Please dont say i probablly didnt even do it. I did.

item.title: How to lose a couple pounds. *Tut*
item.dc:creator: @Speljohan Speljohan
item.description:
@Speljohan wrote:

Not sure if this is mentioned, but there’s a very simple solution. I myself am forced to take a bike to school bus and back 10km/day. This results in me not requiring any additional excercise. So, just take the bike instead of the bus to school if it’s not more than 10km away.

Read full topic

item.title: How to lose a couple pounds. *Tut*
item.dc:creator: @jme jme
item.description:
@jme wrote:

[quote=“pk4pk, post:44, topic:162048”][quote author=jme link=topic=220435.msg2450926#msg2450926 date=1221962965]

Good on you mate.
A good physique is made in the kitchen, once you get the diet right you can just supplement in a bit of exercise per day and you’re good to go.

if calories in > calories out, you will gain weight.
if calories in < calories out, you will lose weight.
Simple stuff.

I know that you know thats not true. You can still gain weight when outputting more calories, for sure you will lose fat (atleast thats if your body has used up all its carbs), but if your excercising heavily, ripping tissue etc, you’ll put on weight in muscle.

Nice fucking year old bump

I wasn’t aware that april 2008 was a year ago…
[/quote]
I didn’t post this in 2008…oh well. I don’t know how to check when I posted this.[/quote]

No, but it wasn’t a year bump because it has been posted in up until April 2008.

Peace nigga

Read full topic
